caption: Extraordinary environment and super personal service. The menu was crisp and enchanting. Will definitely recommend this spot to my friends. Reasonable prices and big portions. Great job.

We read several reviews before going so we were fairly intimidated and unsure of what we were getting into, however, we were pleasantly surprised!  The warm welcome from the owner helped start our wonderful evening. His wife the chef was absolutely phenomenal and we felt as if we were in some small restaurant in France. We were so happy with our choice to dine here and we are so happy that we disregarded some of those poor (but actually funny)  reviews.  Great experience overall...food and service was excellent!
Great prix fixe, if maybe a little too much food. Love that they offered blankets since we were sitting outside. I had a white bean soup and the beef bourguignon, both delicious.

I have had great experiences at the Pandering Pig. The owners/servers are always knowledgeable about their product and you can tell they are passionate. Tonight was my birthday and the owner took the time to sing me happy birthday as they were closing for the night. We were the last customers there and we did not feel rushed at all. We had the pre fixe menu and loved every single dish. You will leave satisfied but the portions arent so large that you feel overstuffed, which I appreciate. Let’s keep this local business going!

The Pandering Pig is a great local restaurant in Washington Heights. High recommendations for the Lamb Shank, and the owner is a wine expert! If you're looking for a quiet place to relax and have a great dinner, this should be on your list!

Our party of 4 enjoyed a wonderful and comfortable outdoor dining experience last night.  Delicious 4 course prix fixe dinner - unique blends of flavors and tastes.  A small but very fabulous restaurant "find" in Washington Hts.   We will be back!  They're making the very most of a difficult and challenging time and doing it in style!  Keep it up!
Went to celebrate my husbands birthday last night. The food was amazing! Dining outside makes it feel like you’re in Europe.
I just love their food. I always get excellent service here. The place is always clean and the cashiers are always friendly. Keep up the good work.

Lovely place, warm and talented people trying hard to make a great experience for guests. Lovely food and wine. The fish (hake) was delicious and well prepared, the lamb shank could’ve had just a bit more savory nuance, but it was awesome, as well. Don’t buy the hit job reviews or the angry neighbor’s BS, it’s a delightful, unpretentious place, with great food and you won’t regret it.
Good food
Consistently delicious food in a cozy intimate setting. Best thing in the neighborhood
Fabulous !!! Really good food. Nice atmosphere friendly staff check it out!
Had the best New Year’s Eve dinner here! The place, (including the owner and staff) are warm and inviting. I really enjoyed the tasting board and my Cornish hen. Can’t wait to go back, cheers!
Charming, Unique, Friendly, Family Owned
very tasty food at a quiet place off the beaten path

Never have I tasted a dish as bland as my lamb shank. It tasted like nothing. The polenta was drowning in this buttery creamy sauce that didn’t sit well. We had to request salt but it didn’t save either my dish or his short rib bourguignon. The cheese board was fine, you really can’t mess up cheese. Brussels sprouts were good but nothing better than what I’ve had before. We didn’t finish them.  And who was our waiter? The lady who sat us down then disappeared or the gentleman who literally repeated the entire menu out loud for us when we can both read? I admit I drink a lot of water, but I had to request my glass to be refilled almost five times. One time she forgot. I had to stare at her while she stood at the kitchen doing nothing while waiting for a dish to come out. Why pick glasses that can’t hold more than two sips of water? At least give the table their own bottle of water then.  Wine was good. Decor was nice looking. Booths had plush seating. We didn’t get to try the broth, but we were told Frank’s carries it frozen.  Wouldn’t recommend. In the same area, I highly prefer Refried Beans around the corner for eating. Never lets me down.

Having now returned to Australia we reflect on many amazing experiences in NYC. One of them is “Pandering Pig”. From the train journey there from Time Square, interesting & easy & seeing a different area being the highest point in Manhattan . “Pandering Pig“ is a small cosy French restaurant. The food & wine is all delicious & very friendly welcoming service. Next time we will go there earlier in the day to have more time to explore this area of Manhattan, before enjoying another yummy dinner at Pandering Pig.
Amazing!  delicious! Perfect!

A true independently owned and operated restaurant, with pride and quality off the charts! The owner is a couple - husband in the front of the house, wife is chef. Small but carefully curated wine list - same with  craft beers on tap. The menu consists of  traditional  French cuisine (e.g. beef bourguignon) with a couple of original dishes mixed in. Each menu item (I've had a few now) is deliciously prepared. A fine establishment.
The best food
Blown away... (Wife's exact words and I agree)
Amazing
Chef is a super star
Nice little neighborhood place, great chef, outstanding wine list
Lovely meal at Pandering Pig. The lamb shank and short rib were phenomenal. Wonderful takes on French cooking.

I walked into this place yesterday for the first time wanting to try some appetizers and maybe a couple of drinks, but right as we entered we were told that if we didn't sit down for dinner they couldn't sit us down because it was kind late and it wouldn't be be worth it for them to keep the kitchen open. Where the hell do you think you are to be questioning how much a customer will spend? You are a small, local restaurant in Washington Heights! Anywhere we go we always spend a good amount either on appetizers or full dinner. So you one more customer you lost besides everyone we will be telling why we don't recommend you as good restaurant to go to. We live in the neighborhood you IDIOTS!
Good times! 😊

The food was delicious, and the atmosphere is romantic and upscale without being pretentious.  The servers were friendly and attentive. I had the salmon special, my husband had the lamb shank, and we were both very happy with our meals.  The shared cheese board was great too - a good selection of cheese with a good variety.

Absolutely great place, food is unbelievable! Delicious French wine is great and the glass was full which is rare in Manhattan:) Lamb, rib, chicken are stunningly delicious:) Please do make a reservation before coming! Btw chocolate desert and lemon tart were exceptional:)

Absolutely worth every penny. A nice little resturant with a relaxed atmosphere. Service and food are not rushed which allows you to enjoy your meal. Everything on the plate complements one another. The lamb shank was some of the best I have ever had. The chicken was a huge portion, incredibly moist and full of flavor. The owners really care about what they are serving and take pride in their product. Everything from the apps to deserts were incredible. I cannot wait to be back, and would reccomend this place to family, friends, and strangers.

Excellent food. The caliber is above anything else in the area - and i live here and love it. There are some other tough reviews on the service but the owner/host is actually nice if you get to know him and they were kind enough to give us a free cheese board on account of the wait.
(Translated by Google) Good attention and rich pie ....  (Original) Buena atención y ricas empanada....

I come visit New York almost every other week. Usually I stay with friends in Chelsea / West Village. However, I will make the trek up to come to eat at The Pandering Pig to visit my best friend who attends school in the Washington Heights / Hudson Heights area.  The service is phenomenal and the owners always remember my name, which is a super-special feeling in NYC.
The BEST addition to this neighborhood in a long time. Quality fine dining with a warm casual atmosphere without having to go downtown. We love you up here!

Ordered through Door Dash, on which this restaurant is listed. Door Dash notifies me that the order has been delivered but I never received the food. Called the restaurant. They said they had the food but that no one had picked it up. I said I'd come down to get it, given I live three blocks over.  Arrive at the restaurant. Hostess gets manager. First thing manager says before I even open my mouth is "that's not my problem." Showed him the Door Dash receipt. His reply? Sniffed, "we are a fine dining establishment, we don't do Door Dash." I asked if that's the case, then why are they listed on the service, and how was I able to order food through them? "I don't know why they have us listed there but it's wrong. You have to take it up with them." I protested and pointed out that I'd just called and was told the food was there, which is why I came in to get it. Also that if they are on Door Dash but don't want to be there, that is their issue to take up with the platform--not customers'. He then got loud, likely embarrassed that his business wasn't in order and unable to skirt it when faced with proof. The hostess and chef then joined in with him. At that point I was upset, and left.  Aside from the poor customer service and tone/attitude, when I mentioned I'd be posting on Yelp, I got back a nasty "Sure, go ahead, tell Yelp!"  What I didn't say is that I grew up in this neighborhood, the very one in which they've set up shop and joined the wave of gentrification washing over Washington Heights. The same kind of gentrification that ushers in newcomers who look down on those of us with deep roots here.  The way I was yelled at, admonished "this is a fine dining establishment" (as if my college-educated, six-figure salary-making Dominican self didn't know that--why else do you think I ordered from you?), and effectively hustled out had a strong whiff of the prejudice and discrimination long-time residents often face when gentrifiers arrive. I've actually chosen to stay and invest in the neighborhood that raised me as opposed to you, who probably picked us up like the proverbial new instrument you'll tire of in a few years.  Will share this with the considerable members of the community I know so that they don't set one foot in your fine dining establishment.  God, I hope you go spectacularly bankrupt. You're already there morally, shouldn't be a long trip.
Cute small restaurant with great vibe.
Small menu with excellent preparation & locally sourced, grass fed etc.   Good ambiance.
Delicious food. Cozy and warm decor and very nice owner.  Looking forward to go back soon

New to the neighborhood and found this place. Food was out of this world - we had the trout and mussels. Service was friendly and attentive even thought they were pretty busy. Seriously, haters on here need to get a life - couple of nasty reviews from people who seemed to not have even dined here.

Tried to eat here, the waiter didnt acnowledge or greet us, so we went to another restaurant. Too bad - the food sounds great but the service is garbage.  EDIT: in response to the owners comment. No you didnt. If the waitress said anything it wasnt audible or visibly adressed at us. You (at least I assume it was you) also saw us and did not bother to acnowledge. Instead of making excuses and pointing fingers, it might be a better move for you to apologize, and ask us to try you out again, while trying to correct what is clearly a visible customer service lapse.  EDIT 2 - the owner of this place is clearly a liar. After looking at some of the other reviews here it seems that you remember every person who comes in weather they eat here or not, and apparently you always have an excuse as to why it's not your fault your service sucks. Stop calling people liars, and start working on improving your business.
Was told really good things about this place, but unfortunately, the service was so rude we didn't get to try the food.
Fine Dining in Hudson Heights

I've visited three times, each with varied experiences. The first time it felt magical, like a family run, neighbourhood restaurant, with the wife running the back of house and producing straightforward, fine quality mostly-French food, and the husband managing the front of house, chatting with the tables and making everyone feel at home. There was a real charm to the experience. The second visit was good, we enjoyed it but just felt like a regular restaurant experience - no disappointment, but no magic either. Finally, last night was pretty 'meh' - started with a bit of miscommunication and ended with just a general feeling of unwelcome.  Not every restaurant has great nights, and I'd still recommend others try Pandering Pig (I like what the owners are trying to do there), but at $70 per person (w/ a single glass of wine), definitely won't be rushing back.
Great
(Translated by Google) Delicious and cousy  (Original) Delicioso y cousy

We walked in in the evening and noticed the restaurant was virtually empty. It’s a small place, and the hostess and another person were in the back, noticed us standing but ignored us for awhile, which was a very strange experience. Usually when someone enters a restaurant you’re immediately greeted or at least acknowledged in some way. I checked my phone and saw they had been open for about an hour and a half, so it wasn’t like we were there right as the restaurant opened. Every single table was open and there was very little activity going on.  After a while the hostess finally walked up, greeted us and asked us if we had any reservations. We told her we didn’t, and then she told us that they were all booked up for the night but we could sit at the bar and eat there. Mind you there were no other customers there, just me and my partner.  It was a tiny bar in the back and there was someone’s coat on a chair next to where we would be seating so it was once again kinda strange. When I thought about how simple it would be to coordinate and seat us at the table with the last reservation time I just made the call to just leave.  If a restaurant is empty it makes little sense to say that the place is simply too busy to properly serve you. A good restaurant would not make someone sit at the bar while there’s no one sitting at any tables or ordering any food.  Maybe in the future I’ll make a reservation ahead of time (keep in mind there’s no warning or suggestions anywhere online that reservations are needed for this place) or get lucky and actually get to sit down at a table and try the food, but until then I can’t recommend this place.

Never felt more invisible in a place. We sat for 30 min. Got a 1/2 glass of tepid water (some of which was spilled on our table and us) then never spoken to again. We ended up walking out and no one working there noticed or cared. Ended up going to another one of our local restaurants and were able to make a really nice evening despite how things began. My advice to the owners is to focus more on service. You literally have 10 tables. If someone would have at the very least taken our drink order or said, "I will be with you in a minute," we probably would have stayed. Never going back here. Felt so unwelcoming.

This small restaurant is a treasure hidden in the neighborhood. I went there last night in a party of six. We were enchanted and satisfied by their French-Californian dishes. The wines and whiskys seemed handpicked and hit all the right notes. An intimate and delectable experience.
Must have paid these other people to write such nice reviews. One owner could not have been more rude. Food is o.k. not worth it.
The food is really really good. It's pricey but worth it for a date night. I'll be back.
Such wonderful food, and a delightful dining experience every time--especially the personal and attentive service.
Amazing food. I had the coq au vin with blue cheese and was blown away. Very stylish and cozy atmosphere.
Really great
Small place, great food, good service. Very high quality ingredients prepared with care.
Hi mom you have good food :)

I don't know if it was the owner or manager, but the guy who served us tonight was a real jerk. Granted, this is a wine bar, and my brother and I came in at 10pm on a Friday and wanted to order beer. But they have a tap list of at least five or six beers, and a couple of bottles, one of which was a cider.  When he saw us looking at the beer side of the menu, he was quick to make a disclaimer that some kegs that arrived today had been shaken, and we might have to try a couple different options. I went for a bottled cider. My brother ordered the namesake Pandering Pig Pilsner.  It was flat. Flat flat flat. And yet when we tried to explain that to the guy, he said no, the keg had just been tapped. Rather than offering a different beer, he took the glass back and offered to put more of a head on it, which was confusing.  My brother and I discussed our confusion, and I decided to get up and intercept this "re-heading". I told the proprietor I didn't think it would help, the beer was flat. Then, rather than actually TASTING THE BEER, he stuck to his story of it being a fresh keg, and KICKED US OUT.  Called us "amateurs". Nice.  Dude. Maybe try believing your customer when they send something back because it doesn't taste right.  We were reasonable, non-belligerent customers who just wanted to sit and have a quiet beverage.

We came here for dinner. It is really good. It is a very intimate restaurant, with not a lot of seating but the it is in the form of couches/booths which give it a nice intimate feel. The chef and her husband interact with diners and give you an extensive detailed rundown of the menu with descriptions of each plate. The food is all farm to table and Napa valley inspired. We tried the cheese board which was amazing. A wonderful mix of complementary cheese and fruits, some cheeses I have not had before. It was very well thought out. We also has the fig and olive tapenade which was also very delicious. For dinner, we had the coq au vin and the lamb shank. The lamb shank is what hey are known for - you will not be disappointed. We also had the coq au vin which was ver flavorful. Both are very healthy portions. We had a great time and will be coming back again. It's a wonderful restaurant to have in this area.

Simply fantastic. Charming atmosphere. The owner told us all about the menu and treated us like we were old friends. They pay meticulous attention to the smallest details. This was one of the few times in my life I've paid $28 for an entree and felt it was absolutely worth every penny. (I had the lamb shank.) With every bite, my husband and I kept grinning at each other in amazement. SO much care has been put into everything they do; you leave feeling grateful and sort of absurdly in love with everyone there! We'll return as often as we can. If you're looking to dine on the cheap, skip the entrees and get a salad or soup and a glass of wine. You'll still be dining like royalty.  I just can't recommend this highly enough. A date night here is the best couples therapy you can buy. :)
A little hidden jewel kudos to the chef. The manager or owner gave me a racist vibe.

Incredible food and amazing service. Lived in the area for years without knowing it’s here. We’ll be back again and again  Side note: the chef very nicely made me a vegan veggie plate so I could eat while my friends enjoyed the incredible french fare

The food here is amazing. My gf and I had the cheese board and some delicious entrees. The wine selection is good, but be careful...a couple glasses here will start to really ring up your tab. I would say everything on the menu is priced pretty well although I would like to see a few more entree options. Although, I know that the high quality demands that they keep the menu small. We paid about $150 (not including tip) for a starter, 2 entrees, and 2 glasses of wine each. So not too pricey, but not an amazing deal either. I'll definitely be coming back here and it's one of my favorite spots in the area.

The Pandering Pig deserves to be in the Village or somewhere with more traffic than Inwood, but I don't mind keeping it to myself.  This incredible French-American restaurant is run by a husband-and-wife team; the wife designs the menu (and is likely the chef), and the husband curates the wine list and helps to wait tables.  All the food here has the exquisite balance of flavors characteristic of French cuisine.  The lamb here is face-meltingly good, and the pate plate, down to the pearl onions that are practically for decoration, can't be missed - and I'm not even a liver person.  Eating here makes you feel warm and fuzzy and cared for.
Delicious, good atmosphere
Great
Fine innovative food in a casual setting. Quality of food and service are above expectations.
Delicious French inspired cuisine. I recommend the spare ribs which were somehow both home cooked and meticulously prepared.  Small seating area so make a reservation if possible.
What an epicurean experience. The service staff and chef were remarkably friendly and helpful.

Amazing food and service. Wow. Worth every dollar spent. The servers here are PROS. There wasn't an awkward moment the entire night; the staff is so attentive and truly gives you a dining experience. We had a French lager here and it was delicious. Our food was excellent. Perfect spot for a date night or special celebration!

Have been wanting to come here for a long time and it was worth the wait. Amazing food and lovely atmosphere. They definitely have an emphasis on quality over quantity which is so refreshing. We had the steak special, mussels, and then a killer cheeseboard for dessert. Can't wait to come back here!
Great service, and the staff are friendly. I've never been disappointed with a meal here.
Such a charming place for a romantic dinner or taking out of town guests. Creative, thoughtful dishes and reasonably priced. We love it every time!

Walk around the corner. Come on in. This a great neighborhood spot for an after dinner wellness drink; or a pint of beer in case you missed dinner. I do recommend the menu. It looks as good as an early summer heirloom tomato. We are lucky to welcome this refreshing Washington Heights addition!
The food was very good. The service was very French.
The best beef short rips ever.
I would have given this restaurant a five star review but the chef's husband who is the waiter is pretentious, rude, and the service is horrible.

WOWZA the food is amazing! The fusion of French/Sonoma/Local produces a lively taste combination. The pâté is attractive and delicious, though not morally wholesome. The place is not fast, so enjoy and take your time. It's not a full bar and best to order off the menu (rocks or up) or ask what cocktails they specialize. We asked for a cocktail and had to give the recipe; slow, expensive, and not spectacular. The place felt swanky NYC for our out of town guests. It was a hit.
Family-run with love that goes into each meal. Perfect for dates, family, friends, anyone. It's a bit small, but that makes it more personal. Get the lamb.
Great
Cozy and romantic space spilling with lush blooms, amazing Provençal cooking with Northern California influences and great family owned restaurant service, highly recommended!!

One the best meals I've had in years in this country. I have eaten in every state but  Alaska. In a lifetimes worth of international meals some are more memorable and a few you will never forget. I am telling you right now this place is shockingly good. Everything  except my coffee was  surprise. I had food I'd never ever eaten before. It is so good I went to personally thank the chef and the owner. This is a real review that is unsolicited. I'm not being paid. It's the real deal.

Twice in a row the food at The Pandering Pig has left me speechless. If you're in Manhattan, this restaurant is the reason you should venture uptown. Or you should probably just make a trip to NYC to come taste this food.

Best tap beer selection in NYC, lovely ambiance, and over-the-top mouth watering food! Everything from appetizers to entres to fresh cut flowers will leave you speechless. Amazing, kind owners. Be sure to make a reservation in advance or you might be sitting at the bar, which is also great. This is officially our favorite restaurant in all of NYC!
Awesome food!!
Excellent Locally Sourced Cuisine. A considerable step up from the other mid level food in the neighborhood. Highly recommended.

EXCELLENT food. We were a table of 4 people and each ordered a different thing and were all blown away by our own and each other's dishes. Will definitely be back.  The food took a little long to come out, yes, but totally worth it. Good portion sizes.
Food took a little longer than expected, but it was delicious. Nice intimate atmosphere for a relaxing Friday night dinner.
Great food and ambiance. Highly recommend. Had salmon special and eggplant app. Both were delish.

They opened around the beginning of this year, so they are still fresh. The inside is a bit small, with very simple decor. Nice exposed brick wall on one side, and earthy tone color wall on the other. Not much lighting fixtures, but with large windows covering the entrance side of the wall, it gets a lot of natural lights. Well, until the Sun goes down.  It was still early when we got there, so they had some empty tables, so we got seated right away. Then the complimentary bread, which were nice and soft, moist and tasty. The butter was a bit too hard, I wish if they didn't keep them in a refrigerator...  Everything we ordered were pretty good, but the portion was very small. It was good that we were not super hungry. Otherwise, it would not have been enough.We shared an appetizer, then had main dish, and shared a dessert. None of the items are not really for sharing, since they are too small of a portion to share.  The service was ok, it was better at first, then got very slow. The dinner took a little longer time than expected because of that, but we were not in a hurry, so that was ok. The food was good, but the small portion for the price tag is a bit high for me. I might go back for something else, but it will be when I am not super hungry. Read my full review of this restaurant and food on my food blog, foodlovergirl.

Went there for brunch, thinking it would be good. We didn't know how good! Excellent servings, well complemented flavors, and good mimosa and coffee. Especially nice was the serving size; they didn't try to overwhelm with volume to make up for dodgy food. Everything was delicious. Well done!
